abstract_summ: In this paper, we discuss that the lack of rapid and timely community-centered approaches, and most importantly weak public health infrastructures, might have resulted in a high number of infected cases and fatalities in many western countries.The coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) pandemic is causing public health emergency and economic crisis all over the globe.Hence, western countries can possibly learn from practices from several East Asian countries regarding infrastructures, epidemiological surveillance and control strategies to mitigate the public health impact of the pandemic.The outbreak of coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) caused by the virus SARS-CoV-2 is expanding globally.This data science pipeline can provide actionable insights via straightforward COVID-19 data visualization for many regions at a glance, which informs of relative time delay of the pandemic progression, projected numbers of confirmed cases in the near future, and the sizes of infections.
title_summ: Latent Blowout of COVID-19 Globally: An Effort to Healthcare Alertness via Medical GIS ApproachMonitoring COVID-19 progression: Look at Us Today, See Yourself TomorrowLessons from the field on COVID-19: a public health point of viewWhat has COVID‐19 taken from us and brought instead?Could India be the origin of next COVID-19 like epidemic?COVID-19: Are We Ready for the Second Wave?COVID-19 and Fake News in the DominicanWhat Can the West Learn From the East?Who needs a Corona?A midpoint perspective on the COVID-19 pandemic.What Is Our Current Strategy?Public trust in the time of the Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19): the case of the DR CongoThe COVID‐19 epidemic of manuscriptsCOVID-19: the end of lockdown what next?A Glimpse into the Future.RepublicHow Is
title_abstract_phrases: See Yourself TomorrowThe coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) pandemic is causing public health emergency and economic crisis all over the globe.This experience could provide some valuable ideas and lessons to others who are fighting against COVID-19.Public trust in the time of the Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19): the case of the DR CongoOver the past half century, the Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC), a low-income and post-conflict country, has experienced several Ebola Virus Disease outbreaks, with different fatality rates.Lessons from the field on COVID-19: a public health point of viewThe COVID-19 pandemic in world affected all strata of population.Hence, western countries can possibly learn from practices from several East Asian countries regarding infrastructures, epidemiological surveillance and control strategies to mitigate the public health impact of the pandemic.What Is Our Current Strategy?The outbreak of coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) caused by the virus SARS-CoV-2 is expanding globally.
